Description: Wooden figure of Nephthys kneeling with the hands raised to the face in mourning; painted polychrome decoration on gesso; five rows of Hieroglyphic text on top of the plinth and a frieze of ankh-symbols and was-sceptres round the sides.
Curator's comments: See PM viii, p. 1102. Published: W. Seipel, Ägypten Vol. 1, Linz 1989, p.157 [123]. Cited: Cauville, Dendera. Les chapelles osiriennes. Commentaire (BdE 118): 231, n.447
